duck.heading: BitTorrent
duck.abstract: BitTorrent is a protocol supporting the practice of peer-to-peer file sharing that is used to distribute large amounts of data over the Internet.

Bencode - Bencode is the encoding used: Bencode - Bencode is the encoding used by the peer-to-peer file sharing system BitTorrent for storing and transmitting loosely structured data.
Glossary of BitTorrent terms - This list: Glossary of BitTorrent terms - This list explains terms used when discussing BitTorrent clients, and in particular the BitTorrent protocol used by these clients.
Torrent poisoning - Torrent poisoning is: Torrent poisoning - Torrent poisoning is the act of intentionally sharing corrupt data or data with misleading file names using the BitTorrent protocol.
Super-seeding - Super-seeding is an algo: Super-seeding - Super-seeding is an algorithm developed by John Hoffman for the BitTorrent communications protocol.
Torrent file - In the BitTorrent file di: Torrent file - In the BitTorrent file distribution system, a torrent file is a computer file that contains metadata about files and folders to be distributed, and usually also a list of the network locations o...

wiki.text:
'BitTorrent' is a protocol supporting the practice of peer-to-peer file sharing
that is used to distribute large amounts of data over the Internet. BitTorrent
is one of the most common protocols for transferring large files and peer-to-
peer networks have been estimated to collectively account for approximately 43%
to 70% of all Internet traffic (depending on geographical location) .<ref></ref>
In November of 2004 BitTorrent was responsible for 35% of all Internet
traffic.<ref></ref> As of February 2013, BitTorrent was responsible for 3.35% of
all worldwide bandwidth, more than half of the 6% of total bandwidth dedicated
to file sharing.<ref>. Palo Alto Networks. 2013. Retrieved 2013-04-07.</ref>

Programmer Bram Cohen designed the protocol in April 2001 and released the first
available version on July 2, 2001,<ref name="BC"></ref> and the final version in
2008.<ref name="Protocol1.0"></ref> BitTorrent clients are available for a
variety of computing platforms and operating systems including an official
client released by Bittorrent, Inc.

As of 2009, BitTorrent reportedly had about the same number of active users
online as viewers of YouTube and Facebook combined.<ref
name="fastcompany1"></ref><ref name="comscore1"></ref> , BitTorrent is utilized
by 150 million active users (according to BitTorrent, Inc.). Based on this
figure, the total number of monthly BitTorrent users can be estimated at more
than a quarter of a billion.<ref></ref>
wiki.title: BitTorrent
